current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize the continued use of certain water diversions located on National Forest System land
			 in the Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness and the
			 Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness in the State of Idaho, and for other
			 purposes.

action-desc.#text: Received; read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Idaho Wilderness Water Resources
			 Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Idaho Wilderness Water Resources Protection Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Treatment of
			 existing water diversions in Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness
			 and
			 Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness, Idaho

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall issue a
			 special use authorization to the owners of a water storage, transport, or
			 diversion facility (in this section referred to as a

land in the Frank Church-River of No
			 Return
			 Wilderness and the Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness for the continued
			 operation,
			 maintenance, and reconstruction of the facility if the

text.#text:
the facility was

the facility has

the owner of the
			 facility holds a valid water right for use of the water on the owner’s
			 non-Federal land under Idaho State law, with a priority date that predates
			 the
			 date of designation; and

it is not
			 practicable or feasible to relocate the facility to land outside of the
			 wilderness and continue the beneficial use of water on the non-Federal
			 land
			 recognized under State law.

allow use of

the

the

			 infeasible; and

preclude use of
			 the facility for the storage, diversion, or transport of water in excess
			 of the
			 water right recognized by the State of Idaho on the date of designation.
